oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Stone's River National Cemetery
Reburials at Stone's River National Cemetery
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: J. A. Stoddard & Co. Chicago, Illinois
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Published and sold in behalf of a fund for ornamenting cemeteries in the states of Kentucky, Tennessee, Mississippi, Alabama, and Georgia, under the sanction of Maj. Gen. G. H. Thomas, commanding the department. WM. Earnshaw, U.S.A., Superintendent

Reinterrment of Union dead at Stones River National Cemetery was under the charge of Chaplain William Earnshaw. Private William Holland, a Tennessean in 111th United States Colored Troops, served under Earnshaw. He later owned a small farm near the cemetery, where he is buried.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Cemeteries--Union; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--African Americans.
The Persistence of Memory; Making Music
